Instruction: Stir the brown sugar mixture and add flour, raisins, and chopped walnuts. Pour the batter into the prepared loaf pans. Bake for about 55-65 minutes, or until a toothpick inserted into the center of the loaves comes out clean. Let the bread cool in the pans for 10 minutes before removing to wire racks to cool completely.

Prepare the day before: In a large bowl, combine sugar, raisins, baking soda, salt, butter, and boiling water. Cover and let stand overnight. The next day, preheat oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C) and lightly greast a 9x5 inch loaf pan.
Stir egg and flour into the raisin mixture. Then, pour the batter into the loaf pan.
Bake in the preheated oven for one hour, or until a toothpick inserted into the center of the loaf comes out clean.
